My eating disorder. Try as I might, I can't seem to shake the anorexic mindset. Every time, I get to a healthy weight, my depression takes over since my brain is well nourished again. So I start to restrict. And so it goes.

WRITING.TITLE: So which way should I go...?

WRITING.TEXT: Andrew Jackson, duh! Leaving behind a trail of 44 tears.

My personal favorite was switching the mice around. They always had crazy long cords so it wasn't noticeable. It was enjoyable watching people try to control their mouse while the pointer just flailed around on their screen. (Or did nothing depending on if there were others in the computer lab).
Was the "kid" next to him a creepy 35 year old pedo hitting on him? Because I'd maybe believe that. Maybe.

Agree completely! You can justify your need to eat to your eating disorder when you're still in the gain phase. It makes you feel like you "deserve" it.
As far as getting past that, I must say, I'm still working on it. What has helped me make headway, though, is eating enough (including that extra cookie I really want now and again) and then getting weighed at my therapy sessions and seeing my weight not change. Kind of proving to myself that I do need food to maintain and then occasional extra treat or whatever won't hurt me.
Carl Gallagher?
Well duh. Dry roasted oil roasted
Wow, you are an amazing writer! Thanks for sharing. It's very relatable and -again- crazy well done!!

I too have struggled with this. And I'm still living at home and my mom is upper middle class so it's not even me paying for it. The feelings of unworthiness of spending money and being a burden but become too much for me. My therapist had me do ERP with grocery shopping- slowly working my way up to spending more money and buying fear foods and such. That's honestly been the most helpful. Have you worked with a therapist with this kind of training? Also, feel free to message me if you need to talk or want more details of the ERP.
Your place or mine? ;)

Thank you for sharing the article! Earning about the scientific basis for many of my thoughts and guilty feelings helps me to see the bigger picture.

After my parents got divorced and my verbally abusive dad moved out. "I never have to talk to him or see him ever again."
378 days and counting.

WRITING.TITLE: I used a knife to self harm and cut way to deep. I lied to my work mates and the ER staff.
WRITING.TEXT: I really want to do it again. Not because I want to go back to the ER. I just loved the power I felt when I slashed myself. I was mad at myself for losing my keys and almost being late for work. And I'm a moment of anger, I grabbed the knife and slashed. I regretted it initially but now I want to do it again and just sew it up myself to avoid the lying. I know I need to tell my therapist about these thoughts but I'm just so paralyzed by fear in every way imaginable.
I feel you because same here. Different symptoms but same ED returning shit. Vent away, friend. And I hope things get better for you.
Take medications away from critically ill hospital patients. Pocket narcotics to take home
23 here. And mine didn't start until 21 so I'm an outlier in that regard too.
Drugs.

WRITING.TITLE: Why the fuck do I want to relapse?
WRITING.TEXT:
Everything in my life is fine. I'm overbooked a little so it's stressful but it's a good stressful. I have friends finally and a decent job. I just started dating a wonderful man who is incredibly sweet to me for some inexplicable reason. I've mostly beaten my social anxiety and my OCD is mostly controlled.
But all I want to do is not eat. I've been making excuses to avoid food and I've been exercising more. Fear foods and fear of restaurants and parties with food has returned. I lied to my boyfriend today telling him I was sick because I was afraid of the buffet we were going to go to tonight. I don't want to do this again, but I can't seem to help myself. Anorexia just seems easier even though I know how shitty it is.
Sorry for the novel. I just really needed to vent.

Effexor has intense withdrawal symptoms that kick in pretty quickly from the short half life so the headache makes sense. It is a very effective med for many people, though, so I'm glad it is working so well for you!
A looooot of shopkins.
I do it...instantly.

I have heard of this too! For sure true for me too so periods of stress and change are relapse triggers for me. I get busy/ my appetite drops and I eat less. And then bam. Back down the fucking rabbit hole.

Yes. The schizophrenia one is/ was very strong with me. All kinds of other illnesses too and checking myself/ the internet for symptoms. I also understand the feeling bad about things way in the childhood past. It sucks; I totally get it. I hope you find solace. Meds and therapy have slowly been helping me, though my brain does like to hop to different obsessions like yours does.
Gilmore Girls!
This is fucking EXACTLY where I thought the story was going. Just watched that episode this AM.
My anorexia. I'm mostly weight recovered/ mentally recovered now, but the experience of being so sick and being in a hospital and having to rebuild my life has fundamentally changed me.
I'm still working on this myself, so just thought I'd pop by and let you know you aren't alone.

I'll show myself out.

WRITING.TITLE: I have pneumonia and the thing that's most distressing is that I can't run well.
WRITING.TEXT:
And I'm afraid of gaining weight because I'm already restored. I can't do much of anything except go to work and come home and sleep. I broke a rib from coughing so it's going to be a bit too. Sorry, this is mostly just a frustrated rant because I know that this should be the least of my concerns right now.
DAE have ED thought flare ups when sick?
That sub induces relapse in me too. Sorry you are suffering!! Can you reach out to a therapist or trusted friend to reverse the restrictive pattern you've fallen into?
I had the same experience. I actually lost a few pounds during my two week trip. The portions are small but very high quality.

The blood work thing bothers me. At the lowest of my anorexia, my blood work was fine. That does not mean at all that I was remotely healthy. The same goes for obese individuals. Blood doesn't tell the whole story and it's just a matter of time before it comes crashing down.
This summarizes my life
Hey, I face the same issue. My therapist said that narcissists never worry about being narcissistic. So the fact you are worrying that you might be proves you are not one of that makes sense.
This. I developed my anorexia later than most (in college) and I feel like I missed a really crucial "coming of age" type time.

Hey, how are your other ED symptoms right now? When I was at my worst for anorexia, I had these same things happen to me. Constantly thirst and drinking insane amounts and needing to pee. Sometimes so badly, I would have accidents and such. When I was treated inpatient, they tracked my fluid intake and determined that my kidneys were in the very very early (but reversible!) stages of kidney failure. It was absolute hell, but they restricted my water intake to very specific amounts (don't do this without medical supervision) to get my body functioning normally again. During that time, I had all the dry mouth and headaches and stuff of dehydration. It sucked, but that with mandated nutrition was the only way to fix it according to my doctor.
That's very Pavlovian. But I approve because that would anxiety/ annoy me so much too.
I had this after 9/11. Terrified every time I heard a plane fly over my elementary school and I live no where near NYC.

Thanks, I appreciate this. I guess at least it's just me feeling a little shitty and not my physical health declining. I have two therapist appointments this week so that should be good. And I think my body image is getting better than it was last week. I was diagnosed about a year ago, but have only really been mentally and physically stable/ functioning for the past 3-4 months. Which from what I've heard, is pretty early on.
